name: to-abstract
desc: Allows you to set the ending point of an arrow to either a predetermined [x, y] coordinate on the chart, or to a charted value.

attrs.name: hook
attrs.desc: Sets the arrow's end point to that of a charted value.  The plot value refers to the set of values in a series, and the index refers to the specific value within that series.  For example, node:plot=0,index=10 sets the end point of the arrow at the 11th value within the 1st set of values in the series.  Note that 0 refers to the first value or set of values, with 1 being the second value or set of values, and so on.

attrs.name: offset-xoffsetX
attrs.desc: Sets an x-offset for the arrow's end point.  Can be used to make adjustments to an arrow's end x ordinate or hook point.

attrs.name: offset-yoffsetY
attrs.desc: Sets a y-offset for the arrow's end point.  Can be used to make adjustments to an arrow's end y ordinate or hook point.

attrs.name: x
attrs.desc: Sets the x ordinate for an arrow's end point.  Ordinates are counted in pixels, starting from the top-left corner of the chart.

attrs.name: y
attrs.desc: Sets the y ordinate for an arrow's end point.  Ordinates are counted in pixels, starting from the top-left corner of the chart.
